titles.title: Strong Families Act
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a credit to employers who provide paid family and medical leave.
Strong Families Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: Strong Families Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow certain employers a business-related tax credit for up to 25% of the amount of wages paid to their employees during any period (not exceeding 12 weeks) in which such employees are on family and medical leave. Limits the allowable amount of such credit to $4,000 per employee for any taxable year.
